document.discussion_title: NYSP: Men sold broken brass pieces of memorial plaque of Civil War-era doctor
document.topic_text: NYSP: Men sold broken brass pieces of memorial plaque of Civil War-era doctor Web Staff Published: August 11, 2016, 7:03 pm Updated: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) White (L), Humphrey (R) OTISCO, N.Y. (NEWS10) – New York State Police arrested two men they say stole and sold broken brass pieces off a memorial plaque of a civil war-era doctor. Police arrested Robert White, 34, of Tully, N.Y., and Cody Humphrey, 30, of Homer, N.Y., following an investigation into the missing memorial plaque of Dr. Willis Webster Munson. The plaque was reported missing from a mixed monument in Otisco on July 22. Police say White and Humphrey sold the broken pieces at a recycling center in Syracuse on July 25 and 26. After seeing a local news report, an employee at the recycling center contacted police. White and Humphrey are both charged with two counts of 1st degree falsifying business records and two counts of 5th degree criminal possession of stolen property. Both were remanded to Onondaga County Justice Center. Share this:
